metadata.case_name: State of Uttar Pradesh and District Magistrate, Meerut v. Plaintiff (respondent)

facts.text: Plaintiff instituted suit No. 678 of 1956 on July 16, 1956, praying for permanent injunction against defendants from recovering certain amount and threatening to evict him from 3/8th portion of premises in Wright Gunj, Ghaziabad.
Plaintiff describes himself as duly allotted tenant of the portion on monthly rental of Rs. 4/4 for some time; offered rent but neither Government nor owner accepted.
Plaintiff, by some arrangement, became direct tenant of the landlord.

District Magistrate notice dated April 21, 1955, cancelled allotment order under which plaintiff held 3/8th portion of house No. 36 and notified plaintiff deemed in unauthorised occupation under section 3 of U.P. Government Premises (Rent Recovery and Eviction) Act, 1952.
District Magistrate notice dated October 14, 1955, calling upon plaintiff to vacate premises within 30 days failing which liable to forcible eviction.

District Magistrate notice under section 12 of the Act dated April 24, 1957 (in supersession of earlier notice of November 24, 1956), assessing Rs. 1522/10/9 as damages at Rs. 21/6/6 per month for unauthorised occupation from December 15, 1949 to November 21, 1955, inclusive of notice fee and interest, recoverable as arrears of land revenue.
Plaintiff served notice under section 80 CPC on April 13, 1956, before instituting suit in Court of Munsif, Ghaziabad.

Defendants contended premises requisitioned under Defence of India Rules on July 26, 1946, and derequisitioned on November 21, 1955; plaintiff in possession from December 15, 1949 to November 21, 1955 without valid allotment order under the Act; damages assessed by District Magistrate recoverable under section 12(1) of the Act.
Trial court (Munsif) decreed suit allowing permanent injunction against proceeding under Act for recovery as arrears of land revenue; refused other reliefs.
Defendants' appeal to Second Civil Judge, Meerut, dismissed.
Allahabad High Court in Second Appeal No. 993 of 1960 dismissed appeal by judgment dated October 28, 1966.
Dispute in High Court on factum of requisition under Defence of India Rules, 1939.
No notification containing order of requisition under Rule 75A of Defence of India Rules produced before High Court or Supreme Court.
No valid delegation of power under Rule 75A to District Magistrate; only delegation under Rule 81(2)(bb) produced, which does not permit valid requisition.

legal_issues.text: Whether the U.P. Government Premises (Rent Recovery and Eviction) Act, 1952 applies to cases where letting or occupation commenced prior to the Act's commencement on December 19, 1952.
Whether the suit is barred under section 15 of the Act as premises are Government premises.
Whether the premises were validly requisitioned by the Government under Defence of India Rules so as to be Government premises under section 2(c) of the Act.

petitioner_arguments.text: Premises are Government premises within section 2(c) of the Act being requisitioned; suit barred under section 15; Act applicable even for prior occupation; damages recoverable under section 12 as arrears of land revenue.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: U.P. Government Premises (Rent Recovery and Eviction) Act, 1952 sections 2(c), 12, 15; Defence of India Rules

petitioner_arguments.text: Respondent cannot agitate whether premises are Government premises as point not taken before courts below.

respondent_arguments.text: Disputed factum of requisition; premises not Government premises; Act not applicable as possession by allotment prior to Act.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: U.P. Government Premises (Rent Recovery and Eviction) Act, 1952

court_reasoning.text: Act applies to arrears of rent or damages for occupation of Government premises even if letting/occupation prior to Act's commencement; sections 4,6 for rent arrears, section 12 for damages from unauthorised occupier; no vested right in suit procedure.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Liability outstanding and premises Government premises suffice; High Court's view that Act inapplicable to prior letting incorrect.

court_reasoning.text: No proof of valid requisition: no notification under Rule 75A; no delegation of Rule 75A power to DM; Rule 81(2)(bb) does not permit requisition.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Premises not Government premises under section 2(c); Act does not apply.

court_reasoning.text: Respondent can support decree on grounds raised and decided against in lower courts or not considered, per Order 41 Rule 22 CPC analogy.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Point properly raised in High Court.

holdings.text: U.P. Government Premises Act, 1952 applies to recover arrears/damages for pre-Act occupation if premises are Government premises.
Premises not proved to be requisitioned Government premises; defendants not entitled to recover under Act.

precedents_cited.case_name: Shri Sripat Rai v. The District Magistrate, Banaras
precedents_cited.relevance: High Court relied on it to hold Act inapplicable to prior letting; Supreme Court holds view incorrect.

statutes_cited.name: U.P. Government Premises (Rent Recovery and Eviction) Act, 1952
statutes_cited.relevance: Defines Government premises including requisitioned; provides summary recovery of rent arrears/damages as land revenue; bars suits challenging orders.

statutes_cited.name: Defence of India Rules, 1939
statutes_cited.relevance: Powers of requisition; no valid order or delegation proved.

statutes_cited.name: Transfer of Property Act, 1882
statutes_cited.relevance: Rent defined per this Act; words/ expressions take meaning from it.

statutes_cited.name: Code of Civil Procedure, 1908
statutes_cited.relevance: Notice before suit; respondent can support decree on rejected grounds.

outcome.summary: Appeal dismissed as premises not proved to be Government premises due to lack of valid requisition proof; High Court decree upheld though on different grounds; parties to bear own costs.
outcome.relief_granted: Permanent injunction upheld against recovery/eviction under the Act.
outcome.costs: Parties will bear their own costs in this Court.

key_quotes.text: "This Act cannot be made applicable to a case where the letting had been done prior to the passing of this Act."
key_quotes.speaker: lower_court
key_quotes.significance: High Court's erroneous view on Act's applicability overruled.

key_quotes.text: "The conclusion of the High Court that the Act is not applicable to a case where letting had been done or requisition had been made or unauthorised occupation had commenced prior to the passing of the Act, clearly runs counter to the scheme and purpose of the Act."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Core reasoning on Act's retrospective application to liabilities.

key_quotes.text: "On the materials on record it is not possible to say that the premises in suit were requisitioned property and Government premises within the meaning of section 2(c) of the Act."
key_quotes.speaker: court
